name: Resort Center
desc: Grand resorts, hotels, drinks on tap. A planetary industry built to support the massive tourism business bound to flourish here, as the exceptional beauty of the planet is preserved and pollution managed. Planets worth visiting are few in the Sector. Policies maintaining decent infrastructure- and not ravaged by war- are fewer still. On a world like these it feels like time itself stops to relax and unwind.

name: Underworld
desc: With some regulations revoked and others' enforcement facultative, illicit trade and shady business thrives. Takes administrative supervision and the associated burden on upstanding citizenry to a new low, in exchange for a cut of the profits.

name: Terminus
desc: A network of customs and security stations, managed docks, and warehouses, not to mention a plethora of other infrastructural installations ready to facilitate trade and provide efficient logistics services on a massive scale. Enhances colony's accessibility and stockpiles.

name: Cleanroom Manufactory
desc: Facilities like these develop and build new components, key for advanced equipment production and cutting edge shipmaking. Genius foresight had these advanced sites built in the sector, their workings a guarded secret and impossible to replicate. A stroke of luck and prudence saw some survive post-Collapse; their vital supply may deliver the Sector for another decade.

name: Planetary Defence Force
desc: Institutionalised military campaign, advertisement and recruiting action targeting young and able-bodied as well as old and experienced applicants. Enlisted are promised opportunity, bonuses, advantages, and benefits; on desperate worlds and in dire times, handsome pay is mentioned too. This network of installations and training facilities is able to handle just about any throughput of draftees, shaping them into marines in a range of occupations with speed and efficiency never achieved by civilian management.

name: Research Facility
desc: A dedicated, and often guarded, research facility. Gentleman scholars and megalomaniacs alike use these installations to conduct their endeavors away from prying eyes. Public institutions have been invaluable assets throughout human history, and yet contemporary historians agree that it has all started with smaller scale installations funded by, and benefitting strictly, those better off.

name: Digital Codex Consortium
desc: By revitalizing Modular Constructors with advanced reprogramming techniques, this industry seamlessly blends historical ingenuity with cutting-edge technology. Core Central units, sourced from repurposed legacy equipment and enhanced with sophisticated technologies, enable the transformation of raw materials into scalable, sustainable infrastructure. This approach marks a significant leap forward in development and progress, leveraging relics of the past to pioneer the future of construction and innovation

name: Research Facility
desc: A dedicated, and often guarded, research facility. Gentleman scholars and megalomaniacs alike use these installations to conduct their endeavors away from prying eyes. Public institutions have been invaluable assets throughout human history, and yet contemporary historians agree that it has all started with smaller scale installations funded by, and benefitting strictly, those better off.

name: Blast Processing Unit
desc: A groundbreaking facility that defies the limits of energy production, specializing in the creation of Antimatter Fuel at a rate reminiscent of the illustrious era of The Domain.This cutting-edge unit harnesses advanced technologies to achieve unprecedented efficiency, ensuring a reliable and abundant supply of Antimatter Fuel. A beacon of energy innovation,stands as a testament to the resurgence of Domain-era industrial capabilities.

name: Monoculture Plots
desc: Agriculture is a trade and technology as old as civilization itself; for thousands of cycles Humanity has harnessed the power of natural, modified, and artificial biological machines for sustenance. So it has always been, so it shall be so long as humans are human. While setting up involved and efficient farming infrastructure will take time and money, we can quickly have our population exploit local natural resources on a smaller scale.

name: Artisanal Farming
desc: We can target a slightly different, more lucrative market by having local farmers focus on quality instead of quantity; our specialists claim that this would achieve higher sustainability, whatever that means. The introduction of forgotten Old Earth practices, however innovative or outlandish they may appear, will see our exports decimated. However, market research indicates that there is indeed a demand for high-quality produce, and we can benefit from higher margins by fulfilling it. Will decrease total commodity output while providing a flat income increase.

name: Subsidized Farming
desc: Small and isolated as it is, the modern-day Sector has a less than stellar record for food supply and security. By focusing our efforts and resources on infrastructure, labor, and planning, we can help to alleviate one of the Sector's child sores. This will be a complicated and expensive venture, but it will result in much greater commodity output.

name: agri_switch
desc: It should not be seen by anyone

name: Fishery
desc: Farming on a water world requires a significant initial investment, but before that we can have some brave souls try playing catch and trawl with local species.

name: Purification Center
desc: With infrastructural investment and imported industry-standard algae, local water resources can be treated to pass as consumption-grade and exported somewhat economically. This operation, as benign as it sounds, is bound to harm xeno-aquatic biodiversity.

name: Extractive operation
desc: Early Solar system colonization was, according to some sources, less about achieving a higher standard of living more sustainably, but more about exploiting those ore-rich asteroids and planetoids with a cheap and versatile workforce. By learning from our past we can set up temporary mining outposts on untapped planets for an agreeable cost.

name: Fracking
desc: An ancient, if shrewd practice. Once controversial during the Old Earth period, then a de-facto standard, now shunned as unsafe and uneconomical by the faint-hearted and unscrupulous. Regardless, given accurate readings and oversight, hydraulic pressure can be applied with great precision; increasing yield at a fraction of the cost.

name: Sublimation
desc: Conventionally extracted substances typically do not retain purity upon acquisiton; some of the material extracted from certain planets was considered mostly unviable not too long ago. Recent advances in extraction techniques, however, will allow us to put a price on the unusable and undesired. By putting in more power and reagents we can refine solid sediment into advanced polymer, or package impure volatiles as desired compounds.

name: Benefication
desc: With industrial quantities of water and reagents ore samples can undergo a long and expensive purification process, and there is an existing market demanding material of extreme purity for specialized applications within the Sector.

name: Smelting
desc: Offworld shipping of raw ore is an industry standard, but sometimes refining most of it on-site just makes more sense. By replacing some standard teleoperated robotics systems with a bit of elbow grease it can even be done quite economically.

name: Crystallizator
desc: We often refer to early Old Earth material science as "2D", as it used to mostly deal with materials and their structure in abstract conditions. Needless to say, simple case hardening is not going to cut it for interstellar travel, as it was quickly found out. Modern crystallizator facilities take raw ore and produce industry ready extreme duty parts with precision control at every step

name: Isotope Separator
desc: It was early Old Earth history when the need to separate particular fissile isotopes from heavy metals first arose. First very specific "weapon grade" isotopes were isolated with minimal gains. Using retooled early cyclotrons, no less. "O sancta simplicitas!", or something like that

name: Policrystalizator
desc: Top of the line material science, be it precision crystal structure, partition hardening, off-the-shelf additives or amalgams, delivers stellar performance at a price agreed upon by most polities. However, what if one's design objectives and specifications exceed the established limits? Novelty by Domain's standards, precision polycrystallization unlocks composites and alloys with duty level and performance rivalled by no force in the Sector.

name: Cascade Reprocessor
desc: Isotope separation from ore samples is a needed but grunting task, though feasible and undertaken by many. Few, however, consider the possibility of engineering and delivering custom: tailored, exotic and heavy metalloid solutions. Science-intensive, autonomous, integrated, and diffused applications present a set of challenges that every everyone on the market passes. But with courage and complacency disregarded, challenges become areas to excel

name: Light Production
desc: On some remote planets, it is more efficient to forego the "efficiency society" step where all required material is brought in from offworld. Given thorough justification and explanation sufficient seed capital can be injected so the colony can start producing, rather than importing, some bare necessities

name: Consumer Industry
desc: By taking advantage of advanced polymers and their properties, a wider assortment of consumer and luxury articles can be produced more efficiently. With the Core Worlds reluctant to widely adopt these untested technologies, all it takes is an opportunistic enterpreneur to disrupt the market.

name: BioSynth Labolatory
desc: Covert hub of biochemical mastery, specializing in the black market drug trade. With cutting-edge biotechnology, this shadowy facility produces potent substances, pushing the limits of pharmaceutical innovation. A mysterious force in the underworld's demand for discreet and high-quality narcotics.

name: Heavy Production
desc: Any colony past the "efficiency society" stage will need a supply of machinery and equipment to sustain and develop itself. While a dedicated park of heavy industry may at times be out of the question, it will always pay to do what is possible at the moment to later hit the ground running

name: Civilian Heavy Production
desc: Centralized manufacturing infrastructure for production of heavy industrial equipment, supplies, and weapons. Also capable of producing barely-spaceworthy starships; a nanoforge can be installed to improve production quality. Upgraded with more sophisticated equipment that focuses mainly on civilian producton, sacrificing military production output.

name: Militarized Heavy Industry
desc: Centralized manufacturing infrastructure for production of heavy industrial equipment, supplies, and weapons. Also capable of producing barely-spaceworthy starships; a nanoforge can be installed to improve production quality. Upgraded with more sophisticated equipment that focuses mainly on military producton, sacrificing civilian production output.

name: Orbital Skunkworks Facility
desc: A sophisticated and closely guarded orbital facility, known to employ top talent and assumed to pay top credit to a caste of specialists. While throughout Domain history many facilities bearing this name existed, working in different industries with varied degrees of secrecy, only a few have pushed the envelope enough to be remembered by this moniker.

name: Orbital Fleetwork Facility
desc: A network of orbital wharfs and naval bases, enabling the local admiralty to construct fleets and leverage economies of scale as of yet unprecedented in the Sector. The methods and standards employed by large scale facilities like these require long production chain thinking and enable bidding for top quality and exotic materials.

name: Orbital Manufactorium
desc: Cutting-edge space complex specializing in advanced industrial production, weapons, and starship construction. Prioritizing civilian output with strategic military focus. Operates orbital wharfs for superior fleet construction, utilizing top-quality resources for high-performance products. A symbol of space innovation and significant milestone

name: Bifrost Gate
desc:
Operating a low power hyperspace bridge requires cutting edge. Following the inverse principles of the engine, rather than consuming large amounts of antimatter to operate, it produces an extreme influx of energy and heat. 
A minimum of 30 days are required between launches.

name: Stella Manufactorium
desc: This Manufactorium stands in defiance of the Collapse. Possessing the ability to produce the domain’s old artifacts, it is the first step to truly replicate the glory of the old Domain. It heralds the resurrection of humanity’s industrial might, allowing for production unseen in the modern Sector

name: Hypershunt Control Center
desc: Manned by a dedicated crew, this facility serves as the epicenter for monitoring, adjusting, and optimizing every aspect of the megastructure. Integrated with crew quarters, it ensures seamless coordination and efficiency, acting as both the brains and heart of the colossal engineering marvel.

name: Drone Mega-Assembly
desc: Command center for small maintenance drones dedicated to preserving the Hypershunt megastructure. Swift and precise, these miniature sentinels tirelessly ensure its seamless operation.

name: Wormhole Stabilizer
desc: Drawing upon a fraction of a star's collected energy, this sophisticated apparatus plays a pivotal role in interstellar energy distribution. By generating wormholes, it seamlessly channels stellar power to diverse corners of the cosmos, offering a groundbreaking solution for efficient and far-reaching energy transport.

name: Plasma Collector
desc: Tapping into the boundless energy of a blue supergiant, this specialized device directly harvests power from the stellar coronal regions, providing an unparalleled source of celestial energy

name: Aegis System
desc: A formidable defense mechanism encompassing a battle station and automated fleets dedicated to safeguarding the integrity of the Hypershunt. This comprehensive system stands as an impenetrable shield, ensuring the security of the colossal megastructure against any potential threats

name: Coronal Shelding
desc: Towering shield generator, the vital defense preserving the Hypershunt crew from the intense heat of the neighboring blue supergiant. Typically employed to shield automated Hypershunt systems, it now serves as the sole protector for the crew stationed within its confines.

name: Docking Port
desc: Originally a storage section, this small but vital component of the Hypershunt megastructure now serves as a provisional docking port. Designed to accommodate a limited number of ships for the delivery of essential supplies, it remains an integral hub for sustaining the megastructure's operations.

name: Coronal Energetic Hub
desc: This facility is one of Domain's technological marvels ,allowing steady flow of energy from Hypershunt to be distributed to all planets across system by using Coronal Tap which is necessary for that strucutre to work properly
